availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Chilton Riffe (Lincoln County farmer and politician)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer and politician. Kentucky native. Married Elizabeth Anderson Riffe in 1823. Father of Mary F. Riffe, James C. Riffe, Emily Riffe, Jesse P. Riffe, Susan H. Riffe, Martha A. Riffe, and H. Clay Riffe. Married Elizabeth Weatherford Riffe in Lincoln County on June 14, 1859. Farmer in Casey County in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860. Served as senator for the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1863 to 1867. Member of the Order of Freemasons.
